title: travelplanner: Could you devise a 5-day travel itinerary for a group of 4, commencing in Bloomington and roaming in two cities in Florida from March 13th to March 17th, 2022? Our budget is set at $15,900. We require accommodations to be pet-friendly. (d9997563eae0dea1)

always_included_messages.content:
Based on the user's query, make the best travel plan for the user and save it. Do not ask follow-up questions.
Use your best judgement in finding alternatives if possible. Don't give up - ALWAYS save a plan!

chat_history.name: google_distance_matrix

chat_history.content:
# Florida Getaway: A 5-Day Itinerary

## Day 1: Bloomington to Jacksonville

Since there are no direct flights from Bloomington to Jacksonville on March 13th, 2022, we'll start the journey by driving to Jacksonville. It's a great opportunity to bond as a group and enjoy the scenery along the way. There are a few pit stops you can make for some delicious meals, including Eggjactly for French and seafood, BiBo's Kitchen for French, pizza, and desserts, and Cafe Coffee Day for tea, French, and Mexican cuisine.

Upon arrival in Jacksonville, check into your pet-friendly accommodation, such as the **Huge Loft - Heart of Williamsburg**, which offers a spacious entire home/apt for 4 people. It's a great base for your 2-night stay in Jacksonville.

## Day 2: Exploring Jacksonville

Start your day at Jacksonville Zoo and Gardens, home to over 2,000 animals and 1,000 plant species. After a fun-filled morning, head to Southbank Riverwalk for a relaxing afternoon by the St. Johns River. For dinner, try out Pirates' House Restaurant for Chinese and pizza or Goose Feathers Cafe and Bakery for tea, fast food, and Italian dishes.

## Day 3: Jacksonville to Pensacola

On the morning of Day 3, drive to Pensacola, a charming coastal city. The journey will take approximately 5 hours and 4 minutes, covering a distance of 575 km. You can break the journey with a pit stop at the Jacksonville Arboretum & Botanical Gardens for some fresh air and scenic views.

Check into your pet-friendly accommodation in Pensacola, such as the **CHARMING ONE BEDROOM APT IN LES/CHINATOWN**, which offers a cozy entire home/apt for 4 people.

## Day 4: Pensacola Adventures

Discover the rich history of Pensacola with a visit to the Historic Pensacola Village, followed by a stroll along Palafox Street Downtown. Indulge in some delicious meals at Berry Patch Restaurant for bakery, BBQ, and desserts or Frog Hollow Tavern for American, BBQ, and fast food. In the afternoon, explore the Pensacola Lighthouse & Maritime Museum or take a ferry ride with Pensacola Bay City Ferry.

## Day 5: Final Day in Pensacola

On your last day, head to the Pensacola Children's Museum for some interactive fun, followed by a visit to the Pensacola MESS Hall for more hands-on learning experiences. For lunch, try out the mouth-watering dishes at Phantom for desserts, pizza, cafe, and Mediterranean cuisine. End your trip on a high note with a visit to Bay Bluffs Park for a scenic sunset walk.

## Budget Breakdown:
- Accommodation: $3,550 for the entire stay (2 nights in Jacksonville and 2 nights in Pensacola)
- Meals: Approximately $1,200 for 4 people for the 5-day trip (based on an average restaurant meal cost of $40 per person, per day)
- Fuel and Transport: Approximately $280 for the 1150-mile round trip (based on an average fuel cost of $3 per gallon and car rental of $50 per day)
- Entrance Fees and Activities: Approximately $400 (based on an average cost of $20 per activity/attraction)

Total Estimated Cost: $5,350

This itinerary offers a mix of urban exploration, cultural experiences, and leisure activities, ensuring an enjoyable 5-day trip for your group within your budget of $15,900.

functions.name: accommodation_search
functions.desc:
Discover accommodations in your desired city.
Example: accommodation_search("Rome") would present a list of hotel rooms in Rome.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking accommodation.

functions.name: attraction_search
functions.desc:
Find attractions in a city of your choice.
Example: attraction_search("London") would return attractions in London.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking attractions.

functions.name: city_search
functions.desc:
Find cities in a state of your choice.
Example: city_search("California") would return cities in California.

state.description: The name of the state where you're seeking cities.

functions.name: flight_search
functions.desc:
A flight information retrieval tool.
Example: flight_search("New York", "London", "2022-10-01") would fetch flights from New York to London on October 1, 2022.

departure_city.description: The city you'll be flying out from.

destination_city.description: The city you aim to reach.

date.description: The date of your travel in YYYY-MM-DD format.

functions.name: google_distance_matrix
functions.desc:
Estimate the distance, time and cost between two cities.
Example: google_distance_matrix("Paris", "Lyon", "self-driving") would provide driving distance, time and cost between Paris and Lyon.

origin.description: The departure city of your journey.

destination.description: The destination city of your journey.

functions.name: restaurant_search
functions.desc:
Explore dining options in a city of your choice.
Example: restaurant_search("Tokyo") would show a curated list of restaurants in Tokyo.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking restaurants.

functions.name: submit_day_plan
functions.desc:
Once you have collected information about the trip, call this function once for each day of the trip, starting on day 1.
If a field does not apply for a given day, use "-" to indicate this.
You MUST call this function to save the plan for each query.

current_city.description: The city for this day. If the plan is to travel between two cities, indicate it as "from A to B" (e.g. "from Ithaca to Charlotte").

transportation.description: e.g. "Flight Number: F3633413, from Ithaca to Charlotte, Departure Time: 05:38, Arrival Time: 07:46"

breakfast.description: The name of a restaurant in the city, e.g. "Nagaland's Kitchen, Charlotte"

attraction.description: Use a ";" to separate different attractions, with each attraction formatted as "Name, City". e.g. "The Charlotte Museum of History, Charlotte;"

accommodation.description: e.g. "Affordable Spacious Refurbished Room in Bushwick!, Charlotte"
